column8: The game is relaxing and enjoyable, perfect for those who love interior design and decorating.

column8: The game has a lot of potential and is expected to improve with future updates.

column8: The game offers a variety of customization options for furniture and room design.

column8: The story mode includes interesting puzzles and tasks that keep the gameplay fresh.
column9: The controls and user interface are not intuitive or user-friendly.

column8: The sandbox mode allows for creative freedom and extensive customization.

column8: The graphics and lighting are aesthetically pleasing and add to the overall experience.
column9: The story mode and mini-games are not engaging or fun.

column8: The game is compared favorably to other interior design games like The Sims and House Flipper.
column9: The game is not suitable for realistic room planning due to restrictive mechanics.

column8: Players appreciate the ability to mod and the potential for future content through updates.
column9: The graphics and visual design are not appealing to many players.

column8: Some players have experienced issues with controls and UI, but overall find the game intuitive and fun.
column9: The game has potential but needs significant updates and improvements.

column8: I could forgive potato graphics but I cannot forgive the unreliable jank of how this game sets you up to see color coded failures in beam loads and suddenly decides to hide this along with your entire bridge beams disappearing. The UI is opaque and mysterious. The UI sounds do not clue me in as to what I am being notified. The language select launch is also buggy and unreliable crashing the game preventing it from launching or stubbornly launching it in German anyway a few times before it somehow remembered my preference to finally display in English.

column8:
im not actually sure if all these crashes, bugs and buttons that stop functioning without a reason are because of bad steam version, modern hardware compability issues or just me remembering how this game was back when i was playing it 10 or more years ago.

but its current state is unplayable. i was even ok with crashes that hit every 2 levels but then the ui actually stopped working and that was it for me..

i will check if i could find my own cd copy and edit this comment if its any better, 
but i remember how hard the hydrolic part levels were and its simply not possible for me to go that far with this much crappyness.
or maybe im just wrong idk.

2 euros foutus en l'air.
Le jeu plante régulièrement. Certaines fois, des éléments venue de nul part (dans la montagne) sortent, et cassent le pont.
En redémarrant le niveau, ca fonctionne. Bref, c'est trop aléatoire pour donner une note correcte.

column9:
2 euros wasted.
The game crashes regularly. Sometimes, things come out of nowhere (in the mountains) and break the bridge.
When I restart the level, it works. In short, it's too random to give a decent rating.
For me, it's worth 2 out of 20.

column8:
The game physics does not work right. In other games you can look at the way the bridge collapses and make changes based on that. Not in this game. The stress screen does not even show if a part is being pushed or pulled only stress y/n. 
The angles that you can place gerders is supriseingly limited to just a particular grid and the menues are slow.

The music is good tho.

column8:
Read the manual.

First, the default language is German, you need to change that in launch options before you start the game.

The game starts fairly intuitive, but not so much as you get further into the "missions". I've already lost over an hour and even though it's been frustrating at times, it's well worth the price, at least when it is on sale.

column8:
Bon, bon,

Je trouve les graphisme acceptable, mais manque le manuel (le touche a utilisé) peut etre qu'il y en a pas, (a part le pavé numerique pour se deplacé de haut en bas et de droite a gauche.  (pas d'inclinaison possible ?)
manque personalisation, manque un peut de clarté pour le stress test (car parfois le pond est vert mais des que la pemiere voiture entre sur la premiere parcel de voie le pond s'ecroule, donc passe de vert a ecroulement. mouais :-( ) (même bridge constructor sur android fais mieux)
manque un peut de variabilité dans les niveau car le concepteur veux qu'on fasse le pond que lui a decidé, (le budget est generalement trop court ou a la piece juste) (en tout cas dans les 8 premier niv easy, on vera apres)
j'ai pas encore tésté la sandbox car on dois gagner/débloqué les pièces.
la bande sont manque  un peut de changement la musique est sympa, mais cest la meme pour tout les niveaux et elle tourne en boucle.
manque de pouvoir tourner autour du pond, manque la possiblité de tésté plusieur trafic différent ou tésté le pond face au tremblement de terre, ou face au vent, etc.

mais pour le prix, c'est sympa à jouer. peut etre le devlopper rajoutera des fonctionnalités.
column9:
Okay, okay,

I find the graphics acceptable, but the manual (the key to use) is missing, maybe there isn't one (apart from the number pad to move up and down and right and left. (No tilt possible?)
Lack of customization, a bit unclear for the stress test (because sometimes the bridge is green, but as soon as the first car enters the first section of track, the bridge collapses, so it goes from green to collapse. Yeah :-( ) (even Bridge Constructor on Android does better)
Lack of variability in the levels because the designer wants us to build the bridge he decided on (the budget is generally too short or just a piece) (at least in the first 8 easy levels, we'll see later).
I haven't tried the sandbox yet because you have to earn/unlock the coins.
The soundtrack is a bit lacking in change, the music is nice, but it's the same for all the It's a bit of a loop.
It lacks the ability to rotate around the pond, and it lacks the ability to test several different types of traffic or test the pond against the earthquake, the wind, etc.

But for the price, it's fun to play. Maybe the developer will add more features.

column8: Habe das Spiel mittlerweile über 15h gespielt. Es ist anspruchsvoll und ist fordernd. Den Negtavikommentar wegen fehlendem Spielspaß kann ich nicht verstehen. Es geht ja in dem Spiel nicht darum sinnlose Brücken zu kreieren, sondern funktionierende und statisch sinnvolle. Dieser Aspekt ist m.E. aus der Beschreibung erkennbar. Ich hoffe auf stetige Weiterentwicklung im Bereich der Szenarien und Stresstest.
column9: I've played the game for over 15 hours now. It's challenging and demanding. I don't understand the negative comments about the lack of fun. The game isn't about creating pointless bridges, but rather functional and structurally sound ones. I think this aspect is clear from the description. I hope for continued development in the areas of scenarios and stress testing.

column8:
Eine Herausforderung mit Suchtfaktor.
Was in der ersten Minute nach einem einfachen Spiel aussieht entpuppt sich als anspruchsvolles Knobelspiel. Die Physik arbeitet einwandfrei und unermüdlich gegen den Spieler. Sind die ersten Brücken noch schnell gebaut so steigt der Schwierigkeitsgrad später stark an. Viele verschiedene Bauelemente die mit einer ausgewogenen Lernkurve verknüpft sind sorgen für Abwechslung. Das tolle an dem Spiel ist allerdings die Herausforderung. Oft habe ich mich erwischt, wie ich aufhören wollte aber dann ist mir wieder was eingefallen wie meine Brücke doch stabil und befahrbar werden könnte. Bridge sieht einfach aus, fordert einem aber alles ab und lässt einen nicht mehr los. Echter Suchtfaktor und das Erfolgserlebnis nach Fertigstellung einer stabilen Brücke sind die großen Stärken dieses Games. Jeder Hobbybastler der weiß warum ein Stein nach unten fällt kann hier bedenkenlos zuschlagen. Für echte Ingenieure oder die die es werden wollen ist das Spiel ein absolutes Muss um gerade auf den Höheren Levels sich selbst sein Können und Talent zu beweisen. Daumen hoch für Bridge.
column9:
An addictive challenge.
What looks like a simple game at first turns out to be a challenging puzzle game. The physics work flawlessly and tirelessly against the player. While the first bridges are quickly built, the difficulty level increases significantly later on. Many different building elements combined with a balanced learning curve ensure variety. The great thing about the game, however, is the challenge. I often found myself wanting to give up, but then I came up with another way to make my bridge stable and drivable. Bridge looks simple, but demands everything from you and doesn't let you go. The real addictiveness and the sense of achievement after completing a stable bridge are the great strengths of this game. Any hobbyist who knows why a stone falls can jump in without hesitation. For real engineers or those who want to become one, the game is an absolute must-have, especially at the higher levels, to prove their skills and talent. Thumbs up for Bridge.

column8:
Nostalgie pur! Es ist zwar schon ein paar Jahre her das ich Bridge gespielt habe. Aber in der Zeit der Casual-Games (baue das an,ernte,verkaufe...) ist es eine willkommene Abwechslung. Der Anspruch steigt mit den Lvls und man muss auch man eine ganze Weile knobeln bis man eine Lösung findet. Aber da zeigt sich die alte dennoch gute Physikengine von  Terathon. 
Macht echt immer wieder Spaß!
column9:
Pure nostalgia! It's been a few years since I played bridge. But in these days of casual games (plant, harvest, sell...), it's a welcome change. The challenge increases with the level, and you have to puzzle for quite a while to find a solution. But that's where Terathon's old, yet still good, physics engine comes into its own.
It's always really fun!

column8: Bridge ist zwar schon einige Jahre alt, es macht aber immer wieder Spaß es zu spielen. Die Missionen sind anfangs recht leicht, spätere Levels sind dann wirklich anspruchsvoll. Wenn man länger spielt kommen acuh immer mehr Nauteile hinzu, erst dann sieht man auch wie real die Physik umgesetzt worden ist. Vom Gameplay und der Grafik bin ich völlig zufrieden. Insgesamt ein sehr schönes Game was man auch mal zwischendurch spielen kann aber dennnoch den Ansprüchen einer echten Simulation erfüllt.
column9: Bridge may be a few years old, but it's still fun to play. The missions start off fairly easy, but later levels become truly challenging. As you play for longer, more and more elements are added, and only then do you really appreciate how realistic the physics are. I'm completely satisfied with the gameplay and graphics. Overall, it's a very nice game that you can play now and again, but still meets the requirements of a true simulation.
